skill.name: doc-coauthoring
skill.description: Guide users through a structured workflow for co-authoring documentation. Use when user wants to write documentation, proposals, technical specs, decision docs, or similar structured content. This workflow helps users efficiently transfer context, refine content through iteration, and verify the doc works for readers. Trigger when user mentions writing docs, creating proposals, drafting specs, or similar documentation tasks.

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only workflow documentation. No executable code, no network calls, no file system access beyond its own directory. This is a safe, documentation-only skill that guides users through a three-stage document co-authoring process.

content.user_title: Co-author documents with structured AI guidance
content.value_statement: Writing complex documentation alone leads to gaps and unclear content. This skill guides you through a proven three-stage workflow that ensures your documents work for readers, not just writers.
actual_capabilities: Guides users through three-stage documentation workflow
Helps gather context and clarify document requirements
Facilitates iterative document refinement section by section
Tests document clarity with fresh Claude instances
Predicts reader questions to identify gaps
Provides editing guidance using str_replace tool
limitations: Requires user engagement through all workflow stages
Does not create documents autonomously without input
Cannot access external systems without user permission
Effectiveness depends on user providing complete context

use_cases.title: Write technical specs
use_cases.description: Create detailed technical specifications with structured sections and reader testing to ensure clarity for engineers.

use_cases.title: Draft product proposals
use_cases.description: Develop compelling product proposals and PRDs through iterative refinement that validates the document works for stakeholders.

use_cases.title: Create decision documents
use_cases.description: Build decision documents and RFCs that clearly communicate trade-offs and reasoning for team review.

prompt_templates.title: Start documentation
prompt_templates.scenario: User wants to write a document
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to write a [document type: technical spec/proposal/decision doc/RFC]. Can you guide me through the co-authoring workflow?

prompt_templates.title: Refine existing doc
prompt_templates.prompt: I have a draft document that needs refining. Walk me through the refinement and reader testing stages to improve it.

prompt_templates.title: Create proposal
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a product proposal using the three-stage workflow. I need to cover context, options, and recommendation.

prompt_templates.title: Test document clarity
prompt_templates.prompt: My document is drafted. Use the reader testing stage to predict questions and identify any gaps or ambiguities.

output_examples.input: I need to write a technical spec for a new API endpoint
output: Great. The Doc Co-Authoring workflow has three stages:
1. Context Gathering - You provide all relevant context while I ask clarifying questions
2. Refinement & Structure - We build the document section by section through iteration
3. Reader Testing - We test the doc with a fresh Claude to catch blind spots
Would you like to try this workflow, or prefer to work freeform?
If we proceed, I'll start with some initial questions about your document...

best_practices: Provide complete context upfront during Stage 1 to enable smarter guidance later
Be specific when giving feedback during refinement to help the AI learn your style
Use reader testing to catch gaps that seem obvious to you but confuse new readers
anti_patterns: Skipping context gathering and trying to write without establishing document goals and audience
Making direct edits to artifacts instead of describing changes for the AI to apply
Skipping reader testing and publishing docs that make sense only to the author

faq.question: Does this skill work with Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill adapts to available tools. Claude Code provides sub-agent access for automated reader testing.

faq.question: How long does the workflow take?
faq.answer: Duration varies by document complexity. Simple docs take 15-30 minutes. Complex specs may require multiple sessions.

faq.question: Can I skip stages?
faq.answer: You can skip stages and work freeform at any point. The skill will acknowledge your preference and continue without structure.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only processes data within your current conversation. No data is sent to external services.

faq.question: What document types work best?
faq.answer: Technical specs, proposals, decision docs, RFCs, PRDs, design documents, and any structured content that needs reader clarity.

faq.question: How is this different from freeform writing?
faq.answer: The structured approach catches gaps through reader testing and ensures documents work for new readers, not just authors.
